storyInfo: Gran Faro, seaside townâ€”a rare sight these days. Rhodes Islanders, Iberians, and even Alive Until Sunset all gather here. A storm is brewing.

attributes.content: 'Terra', 'the land', 'these lands', the nations 'across the world'.
These terms and the language around them flow in widespread use only because of how narrow they actually are.

Has there ever been some majestic language of the ancient past that could describe everything between heaven and earth? Where we put into words the 'everything' we might encounter in our day-to-day lives?
A grandiose term encompassing the earth, the sky, and even the seas of which the landbound nations know so little? A single word to narrate millennia of life's progress?
Where among the collective mind of mankind is such a word, Kal'tsit?
I'm sure you know the answer yourself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know quite a bit myself, yet still I find myself asking, day after day. No man may truly escape the unknown, and the unknown will forever torment mankind.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: (Ancient Sarkaz language) 'Alma.' 'World.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hm. And here I thought you would go with the Sargonian word 'Alam'. The same idea, I think.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Yours was a Sarkaz language?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: It was.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Strange. You're a Feline who calls herself a doctor, yet your first instinct is to use the devils' tongue.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Your identity is like the ever-changing clouds above the sea. Never content to remain the same.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Language will not change its essence for such trifles.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Language, hmm... Now look here, Kal'tsit. A well.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Do you know how to draw water from it? Do you know how the Iberians used these blue cornerstones to build their houses?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: If the Iberian nobility hadn't let their pride go to their heads, the ocean would surely have made the nation an impenetrable fortress.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The well is deep, and we're very close to the shore.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Look. It hasn't yet dried up. There is a false sun inside.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: We should be on our way, sir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The elderly man does not answer her. He simply picks up a small rock in silence.

The rock could not be more commonplace, with no particular reason to fiddle with. Yet, as though absorbed in the sensation of the sea breeze on his skin, he continues to gaze at the bottom of the well.
Kal'tsit doesn't push the issue. She silently waits for the man in front of her to answer. She sees that the clouds are moving. The winds are strong.
There is no rush, Kal'tsit. There is no rush. We have ample time for rest... no matter the arrangements you've made.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: If I dropped this rock into the well, how long would it take for us to hear the splash?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: About five to six seconds.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even the most simple Iberian knows how to make use of the sea. Knowledge that went into this deep coastal well.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: And yet, a Victorian farmer or Columbian worker might not even know what the vast sea looks like.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hmm... Kal'tsit, how many questions have I asked you on our journey so far?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: The old man holds his arm out, the rock still in his palm. Then he lets go, sending it tumbling downward.
Despite its rapid descent, the two of them lock their eyes onto it. Yet without adequate sunlight, they soon find themselves unable to follow its trek into the depths.
It has been two, perhaps three seconds. Nothing but silence shrouds the two of them. Even the wind has come to a halt.
How quiet, Kal'tsit thinks to herself. How quiet indeed.
*Plop*
The quiet sound echoes through the well's walls, as though reminding them that, in that brief moment lasting but a few seconds, all the lands are still.
One hundred twenty-three. Quite a bewitching number.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: One hundred twenty-three questions, over one hundred twenty-three years. The Inquisition boasts not a single Inquisitor older than me.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Most have died in battle, a few of old age, and even fewer gave in to cowardice during their endless ordeal. It did not end very well for them.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: I've experienced all there is of Iberia. I've seen its fleets setting sail, and heard the Victorian envoys quivering.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: It was a rude awakening when the Profound Silence destroyed our nation. My countrymen are still drowning in their hatred for the disaster, and confused over the loss of their dream.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Liberi don't live long lives. Even the Liberi Elders, the oldest and healthiest of them, are unable to shoulder Iberia's present calamity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your age is a miracle. One forged by the Inquisition, and which also grants you an unprecedented sense of devotion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: In that era, when both glory and ideology began to crumble, you and the earliest Inquisition members were revered as 'Saints.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Saints.' A title for those who once served as a guiding beacon for mankind. But just like firewood, it's become nothing but ashes.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: I've watched the seasons cycle by a full hundred and twenty-three times, yet it seems only the cold winters have left their mark on me. I've seen so many truths with my own eyes, yet can never recall the sight of spring.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The look in the old man's eyes changes.
Faith is a language, and prayers can pave roads. At this very moment, the nation of Iberia, or perhaps an existence beyond that, is caressing its chin, examining the wind speed.
So far, I've lived one hundred twenty-three years. I've asked you one hundred twenty-three questions, based on my personal experiences.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Nonetheless, you answered each and every one. You know everything that I know.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Man is making progress, and new secrets will forever emerge, yet our knowledge will never be able to overcome that wall we call 'the known.'
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Regardless, the enemy we face belongs to the other side of that wall, in the dark forest that lies beyond.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: And you, Kal'tsit. Do you belong to our side of the wall... or to the depths of that forest?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: That is up to you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hoh... You might even know the number of leaves on its trees. What a terrifying woman.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Make no mistake, the saints of Iberia remain the pinnacle that humanity can reach. Yet you've exceeded that, marking you as inhuman.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Perhaps you've extended your life with special Arts, perhaps you've inherited some kind of ancient identity, or perhaps you possess a soul that had great ambitions.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Even if our faith is only a lie built atop ideology, we nevertheless once held onto it firmly. What is truly saddening, though, is that when old age finally bests us all, we will have not yet managed to solve our problems.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: While those of us who have bested old ageâ€”via Originium Arts or other meansâ€”will only come to fear endless suffering at the hands of our enemies.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: When did Ã†gir become such an unknown terror to Iberia?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How could an unarmed child so easily accept the help of a stranger brandishing a weapon?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: What if that child were about to drown?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then we would still require proof. Is Ã†gir's current situation really as you say? Can the Seaborn and their source truly be defeated?
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: If you cannot back up these claims, then Iberia will not trust you. I will not trust you.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Before I die, you... you must all prove it to Iberia.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Otherwise, the seawater will quench the flame of civilization. Before the other nations can prepare, they will swarm past Iberia... and tear this 'world' apart.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Perhaps this tooâ€”the refutation of Terran civilizationâ€”is itself a part of their survival-of-the-fittest mindset.
attributes.name: Prudent Elder

attributes.content: Or perhaps there is nothing inherently different between us and them.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A seaside town, huh? Relaxed, but gloomy. Quiet, but bustling. A lively place, but with danger and mystery around every corner.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: Just the place to get us in that creative groove!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: What do you girls say?
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: (Riffs lightheartedly)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: The shore's got an unsettling vibe. I can already smell all that stuff I'd rather not.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I really don't think we should be visiting the waterfront so carelessly.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Does it matter, if we can find inspiration? C'mon, look how fired up about it Dan is.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: (Riffs depressingly)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Time to find our muse!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: Right... It's a good chance.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I can't believe we're actually looking to that messed up ocean for inspiration now.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Yeah, which is exactly why it's a fresh new vibe!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: Took the words outta my mouth.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: (Riffs in agreement)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Well, should we split up, then? I can take our luggage to the hotel on my own.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Alright! I'll be checking stuff out over there.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: All by yourself?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I'm glad SOMEONE's worrying. Just don't forget we're playing with fire here.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: So where's the hotel?
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: That reminds me, how did a small town like this get itself a hotel anyway? Do people even come here?
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: They need to make a living somehow.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Right. No living, no music.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: (Riffs)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: The sea...
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: We're back.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Excuse me... can I get past?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Oh, sure, no problem.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Have you been sitting in the chapel again, Mr... uhh...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Elysium.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Sorry... We've even run into each other several times already.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. The name 'Elysium' isn't very common here.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Actually, someone as smoking hot as me has gotta be a rare sight in Iberia to begin with, right?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't know about that... but someone as confident as you, maybe.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: It took spending some time here to realize that the place that I always called home doesn't really feel like home.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Are you still waiting for someone here, Mr. Elysium? It's already been several days, hasn't it?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Haha, not like I have a choice. That's just how things are in my line of work. Besides, I'd rather hang out in comfort here than that in primeval forest infested with bugs and Originium.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You're from outside then?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Oh, you can tell? Is it because of the vibe I give off?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Actually... uh... I guess you could say that?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Like... the way you dress?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You know your stuff.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Gran Faro doesn't see a lot of visitors... There's not a lot of folks here, so everyone in town knows everyone else.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Besides... What with how close to the sea we are, not a lot of Liberi are willing to talk to Ã†gir these days.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Especially after the Inquisition started showing up more often.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I get you. I've been through similar stuff plenty of times.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Does this happen in other Iberian cities, too? Like in those prosperous ones I hear about in the rumors?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Not just in Iberia, kid. The way I see it, it's pretty much the same no matter where you go. Life's tough everywhere.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But I gotta say, some of the Ã†girs I've met are a real handful. Just thinking about 'em gives me a headache. Wish I could beam all my common sense straight into their brains.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Which makes you pretty easy to get along with, by comparison.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Okay, now THAT's a face asking who'd ever want the common sense of a guy like me.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: N-No it's not!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Sure, I look like an unemployed bum lazing about here 24-7, but I've actually come a loooong way and been through waaaaay too much.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: So... you're an explorer, then? What's life like for the Ã†gir in other places?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not too bad.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not too bad...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Mayor Thiago... You needn't come here every day.
I've been hearing some bad rumors lately. I'm worried about you guys, Amaia.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Bad rumors... You mean about the cultists?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But we're not just close to the sea, we're close to the Inquisition too, and the very heart of Iberia.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: So how could there possibly be cultists here?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Who knows? Happens all the time in coastal towns though. Hardly peculiar at all.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Also... I heard someone saw a monster on the shore.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Did Old Pedri tell you that?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You know the kind of nonsense he goes on about when he hasn't had his drink.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You're a kind man, Thiago. I'm sure you're just worried about Jordi, the boy who works at the chapel.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I... I'm not a very sophisticated one though. Maybe you can put me at ease... help me sleep better at night.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: These rumors are just rumors, right? The ghost ship, the cultists, the sea monsters?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The Inquisition hasn't let us go out to sea in a long, long time.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Right. Can't even remember how long... Eighty-four years? Eighty-five?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Try fifty-six. The Profound Silence happened in 1038.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Have you really been trapped on land for so long, in your memories? You aren't even that old. Have you been a prisoner of this place since before you were born?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If living in poverty counts as imprisonment, then yes, I've been a prisoner for a long, long time.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I haven't so much as looked at the sea since Marin died. I loathe it.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But you're not worried about the gossip, are you? You're worried about the Inquisition. And even more so about the Penal Battalion coming here to take away all the Ã†girs.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: *Sigh*, poor Thiago...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The Inquisition snuffed out the love of your life, an Ã†gir woman. Your anger and resentment is perfectly understandable, but be careful what you say. For everyone's sake.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Maybe you're right.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Okay, I'll be careful. You always know more than the rest of us, anyway. So what've you been up to lately?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The same old. Doing my job as a third-rate translator in this frighteningly laidback seaside town.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That said, it's been months since a Messenger stopped by. All my drafts have been piling up, and it's giving me a headache.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Translation! I've never even set foot outside this small town my whole life. Anything besides Iberian may as well be gibberish to me.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Hm, it's getting late.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Right, Jordi should be off work soon. I only hope that the Inquisition isn't gonna give the lad any trouble over that gossip, these next few days.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'll see you later.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Be safe, Mayor Thiago.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Cultists. Hm.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The young woman named Amaia ponders for a moment before turning her mind back to the papers, as always.
Ursine novels, Kazimierzian biographies, Leithanian poetry... even Sargonian folk tales.
All the lands of Terra lie before her as a thick pile of literature, each word waiting to be deciphered in a solemn, orderly manner.
The air is extraordinarily humid. She can't help but pinch the corner of the page.
The sensation of the sea...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: 'The waves continue to accelerate, and the winds are frightened. The corals line the sky, painting it a neon shade.'
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: 'We will come to detest ourselves for not having wings.'
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Are you finished with your work?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Ah, uh... yes.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As you can see, the chapel doesn't see a lot of visitors. I mostly just keep the place tidy.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Are you still waiting today?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yeah. They should've been here by last week, but my superior did warn me that they're a weird bunch. So I guess being late is normal enough.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Still, it's hard to call that a good thing. But why would anyone choose to meet up in Gran Faro of all places?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Strange, right? I thought so, too. That's why I volunteered for the job when Misery brought it up.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not that I expected to waste a whole month here. That's a hell of a long time to be on standby.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But... normally the Inquisition wouldn't have let outsiders like you in at all.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Because of how close it is to their command center?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Or... because it's close to the sea?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Maybe both.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: So how did you make it here? I haven't traveled much, but even I can tell that Gran Faro is a backwater...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If you really wanna know, I could use someone to chat with. I'm dying of boredom over here.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Then if it's not too much troubleâ€” Oh!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Sorry, I didn't realize it was so late. Uncle Thiago is waiting. I should head back to make dinner.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Family?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Uh... Something like that. He's the one who raised me.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Look, you don't have to be such a doormat just because you're an Ã†gir. When someone's kind to you, try to be more positive.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Uh, thanks... Mr. Elysium.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Gran Faro. It means 'the great lighthouse' in an ancient Iberian tongue.
Lighthouses once shone upon ships both large and small, and served as homes for all seamen to return to.
Many souls dwelled beneath the reefs, until the ships fell in love with the ocean, accepting its embrace and facing their own destruction.
(Amaia? Where is she going... Hm?)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (Some sort of commotion up ahead? That's unusual. What's going on?)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Where are you heading?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: The chapel! Peeps here shouldn't be using their hands to pray, they should learn to drum instead!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: This square is the center of the town. Everything's built around it.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: A sculpture of a lighthouse.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: A guiding landmark to the sea... and the town.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: What a lame analogy!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: What a bunch of weirdos. Let's not get too close.
attributes.name: Passing Townsperson

attributes.content: Didn't Old Pedri mention something like this before?
attributes.name: Spectating Townsperson

attributes.content: Don't get involved, lest the Inquisition take you away.
attributes.name: Passing Townsperson

attributes.content: Sheesh, why are there all these outsiders lately? The Inquisition just doesn't care anymore, huh?
attributes.name: Passing Townsperson

attributes.content: (I haven't seen any of them before... Look at the way they're dressed... Are they musicians?)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (Er, is she looking at me?)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: H-Hello?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: In the past, I wouldn't have batted an eye at seeing an Ã†gir near the coast, but it sure is a rare sight these days.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Do you know what's going on here?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: W-What?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Oh, you wouldn't, huh? You aren't a child of the sea. You're land-born.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Not that that's much of a surprise. Jeez.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Aya, over here!
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Coming!
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Oh, right... you... hmm...
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I-Is something the matter?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do you know what that sculpture is of? And do all the locals know?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Yes... It's a lighthouse. Apparently, they needed a lot of people to work on it way back when, and many of the workers' families ended up staying here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Like yours?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Uh... Yes. I still keep some relics from that era back home. Like, blueprints and pictures.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yep... lighthouses. Iberian lighthouses. In a country on the land. That's kinda funny.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Anyway, the scent doesn't seem to be coming from you. Alright, then, you be extra careful.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I've never seen those people... Are those instruments?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Maybe they're the ones Mr. Elysium has been waiting for?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Oh, Uncle Thiago. Sorry. I should've come back soonerâ€”
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't you get involved with them. I didn't see ears OR tails, and no feathers either. They might be Ã†girs.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Iâ€”
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi, my boy. You know I don't have anything against the Ã†gir, but remember what everyone's been saying lately.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Don't get too involved with these outsiders. If you see an Ã†gir near the sea and there's no one from the Inquisition or Penal Battalion around, then they gotta be trouble.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I don't think they're bad people, but the Inquisition might not see things the same way, so... I'm sorry. I just don't want to see them take you away. Be a good boy and listen.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I get it. You don't have to apologize.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I get it...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I didn't expect you to agree so quickly.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know of the events in Sal Viento, with the three Abyssal Hunters. Irene always writes the most detailed reports, after all.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: And above all, I know that if you meant Iberia harm, you had other, much simpler options.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The Abyssal Hunters... Suppose they are as strong and swift as the report suggests. The three of them are still controllable by the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We retain the authority to sentence them to death. The only reason they are still allowed to walk Iberian lands is thanks to my curiosity towards your so-called truth.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I can't help but wonder if Iberia's current predicament is a result of its pride, then.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The truth is that no one knows pride better than us. Pride is like the shadow always lurking behind every man.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The two inquisitors with whom you're acquainted have already received orders. Should the need arise, they will appear before us.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: It seems we have a few unidentified Ã†girs in Gran Faro as well. You never mentioned them.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Who are they?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: They aren't Ã†gir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Iberia is rarely mentioned in the historical record, but that doesnâ€™t mean our history is short. At the height of our prosperity, we crossed the entire continent, advancing troops to even BolÃ­var.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Both coin and knowledge flooded into our cities like streams pouring into a valley from a high cliff. Those glorious waterfalls roared so deafeningly loud that they could overcome even the waves of the sea.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: (Sargonian) Those beings that arose... or rather, the 'Feranmut.'
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Perhaps it is them that I should keep an eye on. They show no signs of hostility, yet they keep me on edge... Maybe they once belonged to the sea.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, you are the doctor here. Could you do the Inquisition a favor?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...Ask away.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Inquisition's command center is very close to the coastline. We are prepared to face destruction at any moment.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But I need you, an outsider, to be our eyes, gazing forward.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Seeing as we're in the same boat, I have no reason to refuse.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Please, Doctor, spare me the mysteriousness your long life has earned you. Show us where the evil that lurks within us sleeps.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I'll take that as a compliment... and it would be my honor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Gladiia.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Our brief time together has you addressing me differently. On that point alone, you are quite different from before.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain, I have a question.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We've already shared all the information we have, in the time since we left that reeking coast.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Not all of it.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We alone are more than enough. I don't understand why we must also bringâ€”
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Look at her now. This is how she once was.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I looked into all her treatment records at Rhodes Island... You've never seen her this quiet before either, have you?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Don't you want to help her?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And this will help?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: She alone can defeat her illusions. She is her own key. She can break through the results of those filthy experiments. She's Laurentina, after all.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But until then, we need to prepare a warm bed for her.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It was only for a short while, but she woke up... Even so, I stared at her like that.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Don't be so sentimental. We aren't her. If she doesn't mind the way she is, we have no right to meddle in it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You trust Dr. Kal'tsit more than I thought you would.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Maybe. She willingly stayed in Iberia and created this opportunity for us. I was surprised. And I have to thank her.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I can only hope it all goes well for her.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Look at the time.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Guess it's not happening today either. And here I thought I'd get to see them sooner or later just by waiting in the most conspicuous building in town.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: This really is such an uneventful place, though. If I'd known it'd be so boring here, I would've brought along a few more books from Rhodes Islandâ€”
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: â€”A Lateran chapel! And in such a great shape, even right next to the sea! Unbelievable! This place's style really has a different vibe, though.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I mean, as long as there are Laterans in chapels, we can jam whenever, but this place just feels so gloomy... Hm?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Ahhâ€”
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: â€”Alty?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You'd best stay away from the sea, Jordi. The chapel is clean and safe. Just stay there.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Don't worry about anything else. Not a lot of the young ones came back this year. Most who left looked for ways to move to the big cities. And now we rely on the Inquisition's handouts to get by.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You should think about what I said and leave this place. The folks here are the families of the workmen who gathered here to maintain the lighthouse in the past, but times have changed. This place will be abandoned sooner or later.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Jordi?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'm listening, Uncle.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's just... where can an Ã†gir go?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Amaia told me that there are places outside, in other parts of Iberia, where they aren't so harsh on the Ã†gir.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But I'll need to find a home for myself eventually. I need resources, connections. I... can't make a decision that easily.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I... I'm not ready yet.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...If you say so.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Right, Amaia gave me another book, one she translated herself. Not like I'd understand it anyway, though. Take it with you to kill time over in the chapel.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi walks down the street quietly.
Seeing the old man in front of him hunching over more and more, he can't help but think back to how he looked just last year.
As if to prove how time slowly overtakes us all, senility is always silent. From the moment you wake up to when you fall asleep, every second is like a gasp for air.
But Jordi never complained. He's used to this life, after all.
Uncle...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'm pretty happy with my life right now. I get to help out at the chapel. Sometimes I help take care of the children, and sometimes I help patch up the injured workmen.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I even got to know that Liberi who came from out of town the other day. He's so different from everyone else. He said his name is Elysium. You don't have to worry about me.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's been a long time since the Inquisition came to town. We don't always have to be so nervous.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's not a chapel, lad. It's a sentry post. The Inquisition set it up to keep their eyes on us, back when we were still trying to repair the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But now that the coastline is peaceful and the work on the Eye of Iberia is shelved, of course the Inquisition doesn't give a toss about us anymore.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Still, to be fair, the Inquisition isn't completely useless. Only they can stop those...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Those...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Nothing, lad. Just a few rumors going around among the workmen.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Rumors, hm...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Lad?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: H-Here...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What exactly is that...? Should I let Uncle Thiago know...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Something bothering you, lad?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Uncle... Just what is there out at sea?
attributes.name: Jordi
